item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. I've had a change of heart regarding employee metrics (51 points | 10 comments)
2. Scientists glue two proteins together, driving cancer cells to self-destruct (211 points | 56 comments)
3. An embarrassingly simple approach to recover unlearned knowledge for LLMs (62 points | 6 comments)
4. Project Sid: Many-agent simulations toward AI civilization (275 points | 87 comments)
5. Hertz-dev, the first open-source base model for conversational audio (84 points | 10 comments)

7. Hacker News Data Map [180MB] (133 points | 19 comments)

10. Programming Avant-Garde (11 points | discuss)

12. HardenedBSD Feature Comparison with OpenBSD, FreeBSD, NetBSD (70 points | 25 comments)
13. ToolGit: A collection of scripts that extend Git with various sub-commands (91 points | 46 comments)
14. Interview gone wrong (58 points | 74 comments)
15. Programming languages that blew my mind (2023) (207 points | 110 comments)

18. ASCII control characters in my terminal (5 points | discuss)
19. gptel: a simple LLM client for Emacs (101 points | 20 comments)

22. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (211 points | 80 comments)
23. The Submerged Nabataean Temple in Puteoli at Pozzuoli, Italy (38 points | 7 comments)
24. Please just stop saying "just" (2019) (98 points | 65 comments)
25. GJS: Node.js Like Runtime for Gnome (12 points | discuss)
26. Why Facts Don't Change Our Minds (62 points | 44 comments)
27. Speed, scale and reliability: 25 years of Google datacenter networking evolution (264 points | 69 comments)
28. Wasp Flamethrower Drone Attachment (31 points | 35 comments)
29. Top discoveries about ancient people from DNA in 2023 (46 points | 2 comments)
30. Building My Resume in HTML Using Eleventy (61 points | 50 comments)
